item.title: Car Parked blocking bus path and side street, 11th February
item.description:
Car parked here for second day in row. No driver in car or hazard lights ? Red lines. obstructing entry to bus lane and partially blocking side streets to cyclist lane. Both yesterday (10th) and this morning (11th) the car has been observed at same spot from around 08.35 onwards. I was at bus stop for 10 minutes no driver seen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Newington Causeway, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Parking Blocking Access, 11th February
item.description:
Subject Illegal Parking Blocking Access Hello, As you can see in the attached picture, people are using this area for parking, even though parking is not allowed here.Woodsford building Portland Street London The vehicles are blocking the entrance, which makes it impossible to remove the rubbish and access the area properly. Could you please send local officers to address this issue? Thank you for your assistance. Kind regards,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo in black bags dumped on the ground (for at least the third time in a year), 11th February
item.description:
This person has again been dumping black dog waste bags filled with poo along a route that many young children walk to get to school. Some have unfortunately split open (there is also one just outside of the alleyway, outside the school)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witham Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor heavily repatched section of road, 11th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knollys Road, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: 12” pothole, 11th February
item.description:
12” wide pothole appeared on a previous repair in the driving line of the nearside wheels. approximately 5” deep. A considerable bang was heard when driven over. definitely getting worse day by day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harewood Avenue, Marylebone, City of Westminster

item.title: Fly tipping and rubbish, 11th February
item.description:
The entire planting area along upper clapton road meeting Lea Bridge roundabout has been used as a dumping ground for a very long time and desperately needs to be cleaned. It’s a serious health risk

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Upper Clapton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree req pruning, 11th February
item.description:
Tree directly outside 194 Birkbeck road the roots are causing cracks in the drive and front porch. Please can this be inspected. JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkbeck Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Assortment of items dumped here from residents of 147 Gayhurst, 11th February
item.description:
Its is an eyesore walking by this and i know that my neighbours at 148 would not do this as they are respectful to their neighbours and where they have lived for well over 40 years and know how to dispose of items. Not to mention there is a rubbish shoot just around the corner which they can place these items in but are too lazy. This is a health hazard as residents of 148 are elderly whereas the residents of 147 are fairly young. They have no respect for where they live

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hopwood Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
